script: Despite his meandering maneuverability, his strategical susceptibility, his infantile indefatigability And his tendency towards tantrum capability, he still remains-- An imaginary sound of music.
Ever had one of those nights that starts out like any other, but ends up being the best night of your life?
It was June the 22nd, 1990, our final day of school.
There was Oliver Chamberlain, Peter Page, Steven Prince, Andy Knightley and me.
He fancied himself as a bit of a player, but really he was all mouth.
We called him O-Man because he had a birthmark on his fore- head that looked like a six.
Pete was the baby of the group.
He wasn't the kind of kid we'd usually hang out with, but he was good for a laugh.
Steve was a pretty cool guy.
We jammed together, chased the girls.
I think he saw us as rivals.
Andy was my wingman, the one guy I could rely on to back me up.
He loved me, and I'm not being funny, but I loved him too.
-There was nothing we were gonna miss about school.
He used to ask me what I wanted to do with my life.
I told him I just wanted to have a good time.
Newton Haven was our hometown, our playground, our universe.
And that night, it was the site of a heroic quest.
The aim-- to conquer The Golden Mile, 12 pubs along a legendary path of alcoholic indulgence.

There was the first post, the old familiar, the famous cock, the cross hands, the good companions, the trusty servant, the two headed dog, the mermaid, the beehive, the King's head, the hole in the wall, all before reaching our destiny, the world's end.
We took my car into town.
-And so our journey into manhood began.
We hit pub one, and we hit it hard.
There was drinking, there was fun, there was controversy, there were ladies, there were shots, there was drama, and of course there was drinking.
By pub five, we were feeling invincible And decided to purchase some herbal refreshment from a man we called The reverend green.
Pint six put O-Man out of commission, so we carried on without him.
We went into the disabled's, and I bumped into her again.
Sam tagged along for a while, but then I had to let her go.
I had another date that night, and her name was Amber.
Nine pints in, and it was us against the world.
Things got mental in the beehive, so we repaired to the bowls club, or as we liked to call it, the smokehouse, which is when it all went fuck-up.
Everyone got para and Pete chucked a whitey, so we had to bench him.
In the end, we blew off the last three pubs and headed for the hills.
I remember sitting up there, blood on my knuckles, beer down my shirt, sick on my shoes, seeing the orange glow of a new dawn break And knowing in my heart life would never feel this good again.
Would anyone like to add anything?
That you didn't make it to the world's end.
We wanna be free to-- to do what we wanna do.
And we wanna get loaded, and we wanna have a good time, and that's what we're gonna do.
We're gonna have a good time.
Just what is it that you want to do?
We wanna get loaded, and we wanna have a good time.
Were you outside my house this morning?
I could have swore I saw you on my street.
I've never been to Bishop's Gardens.
-So, Gary, how can I help you?
Are you looking to buy a car?
I'm afraid the end is nigh.
Isn't that something you've always wanted?
Look, Peter, we didn't make it before.
But this time we are gonna see it through to the bitter end.
Well, I thought that after the accident-- Not an issue. He is in.
What we wanna know is, are you?
Well, I'd have to check with Vanessa.
Since when have you had to check with your wife?
The hangovers so fierce, it feels like your head's full of ants?
This entire row here, they'll all have dormer windows above the front elevation.
Who's the helmet without an helmet?
You're supposed to say, who's there?
I like what you've done with the place.
-You got anyone else on the go?
We're getting the band back together.
I'm not your bass player anymore.
I mean, we're getting the boys back together.
We can get the band back together as well, if you want.
I've always wondered, what is that thing over the door called?
-So, the plan is, we're gonna go back to Newton Haven, we are gonna do The Golden Mile, and this time we are gonna make it to the world's end.
Oh, you better believe it, big balls.
Go back to the old town, sink a few pints-- -Twelve pints.
Why should getting older affect something as important as friendship?
A lot's changed since then, Oliver.
This is our chance to take stock.
What I'd really like is for you to take your D.M.'s off the sofa.
Look, if you're worried about me, don't be, all right?
I am here to tell you that Gary King is back on the horse.
You're-- You're back on the horse?
Listen, this is our chance to finally finish what we started.
Ah. Um-- I think we're all done, so-- H-how do you like the property?
It's just a little bit out of our price range.
So, Friday we'll all go down together, make a road trip of it. I'll drive.
Oh, I don't think I can.
Yeah, you do-- with Dr. Ink!
It won't be the same without the O-Man.
You have a friend here to see you.
This is a bit grown-up, isn't it?
I saw the boys the other day.
Yeah, I remember the names of our childhood friends, Gary.
We had ourselves a little idea.
Yeah, we're gonna go back to Newton Haven.
I haven't had a drink for 16 years, Gary.
Look, we can go back, see the guys, chew the fat.
It'll be just like it always was.
Except this time, we are gonna finish this thing once and for all.
You have a very selective memory, Gary.
Yeah, that's why we're going back on a Friday. Uhhh!
Why do you think none of us live in Newton Haven anymore?
Because it is a black hole.
It always was, and it always will be.
It's only boring 'cause we're not there.
I'm picking everybody up from high Wycombe station, Friday, 3:00 sharp.
Oh, um, I thought you should know-- What?
She just always really liked you, you know.
Got me thinking about the old days, particularly that night, you know.
And, you know, I love the boys like brothers, but, uh, when all's said and done, you're the best friend I ever had.
It was good to see you, mate.
I reckon that's not the last horrible feeling you're gonna have today, mate.
This can't be happening, can it?
What the hell are we doing here?
Follow Gary King into almost certain oblivion.
Didn't we decide to stop calling him fearless leader somewhere around 1992?
They'll be putting that on Gary's tombstone.
I'm just trying to decide which of us is the biggest idiot for coming.
Gary having an accident would actually be the best outcome for all of us, including Gary.
-I can't believe you bought another Granada Mark II.
Well, this looks exactly like the car I sold you in 1989.
This is the car you sold me in 1989.
I mean, she's had a bit of work done.
I had to replace the, uh, brakes, suspension, exhaust, seats, wheels, paneling, carburetor, manifold-- whole engine, really.
You could almost say an antique.
Well, then, let's get this antique On the roadshow!
Come on, you bell-ends, we're gonna be late.
And we're back, just like the Five Musketeers.
Nobody knows how many there were, really, do they?
You do know the Three Musketeers is a fiction, right?
A lot of people are saying that about the bible these days.
What, that it was written by Alexandre Dumas?
I think they missed a trick only having three, 'cause if they'd had five, then two could have died and they'd still have three left.
I put this on a tape for you, didn't i?
Still work for your old man, Pete?
I started my own firm in '98.
Yeah, I co-manage a boutique estate agency in north London.
Is it family law you're in, Andy?
Does anyone know what Gary's doing?
-Yeah, he's playing need for speed over there.
He did finally pay me back that 600 quid.
I can't believe you'd do that.
It's just robbing Peter to pay Paul!
No, I borrowed it from Peter to pay you.
Take a moment to look upon it in its original colors, boys, for tonight we paint it red.
-Oh, no, no, no, no, no, no!
Fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck!
Know why I pulled you over, Sir?
I'll get that sorted out, officer.
And I left that at the bloody gym.
No. It's all in my sports bag.
Um, I'll give you my name and address.
You can run me through the old system?
Peter Page, 48 Bishop's Gardens, London, N2 T12.
-Why did you give him my name?
-Suppose I get done by the police!
He will check the number plate against his name.
I know. Why do you think I gave him Pete's name?
So, Mr. Page, what brings you to Newton Haven?
We're just back to see the sights, have a crack at the old golden mile.
Well, you make sure you get that brake light fixed.
You might wanna do an emissions test too.
Oh, and, Peter, don't make too much mess.
I know. I changed the log book.
Jesus, you guys need to relax.
Do you know how much trouble you could get into?
Do you know how much trouble I'm already in?
Oi. What the hell is this?
We are here to get annihilated.
-Have you got any plans for dinner at all?

Tonight we will be partaking of a liquid repast As we wend our way up The Golden Mile, commencing with an inaugural tankard in the first post, then on to the old familiar, the famous cock, the cross hands, the good companions, the trusty servant, the two headed dog, the mermaid, the beehive, the King's head, and the hole in the wall for a measure of the same, all before the last bittersweet pint in that most fateful terminus, the world's end.
Leave a light on, good lady, for though we may return with a twinkle in our eyes, we will, in truth, be blind drunk!

This building was the site of Newton Haven's first post office, until an enterprising business fellow decided that, far from befitting the sending and receiving of mail, it was perhaps better suited as a humble taproom Where a weary traveler might get twatted.
I don't remember this at all.
Been bought by a chain, hasn't it?
Part of that nationwide initiative to rob small, charming pubs Of any discernible character.
Can't take away that smell though.
Who's on the guest list tonight?
We, Sir, are doing The Golden Mile, and you have the honor of drawing first blood.
Does it have a surprisingly fruity note which lingers on the tongue?
Mmm! We'll have five of those, please.
A man of your legendary prowess Drinking Fucking rain.
It's like seeing a lion eating some hummus.
You seriously have a problem with me not drinking after what happened?
I don't, but King Arthur does.
Do you honestly think that King Arthur came back from The Battle of Hastings, fucking rocked up at Arthur's castle-- Camelot.
Walked up to the bar and went, hello!
No, because they didn't have running water in Arthurian times.
I'm less of a man because I choose to drink water?
-Well, it's a bit ooh, ducky, isn't it?
There is nothing ooh, ducky about being teetotal.
About walking into a pub after a rugby match and ordering a tap water At a bar packed full of big ugly bastards wearing war paint?
That, my friend, takes confidence. Yeah?
I don't know if you're aware of this, but we are not teenagers anymore.
And God forbid you ever have children-- -I might have kids.
No, I mean I might have kids.
You remember Karen Eggerton She was two weeks late when her parents emigrated to Normandy.
I never heard from her again.
She might have had a baby.
To kids, wherever they may be.
That's it. If we needed to make a quick getaway, we'd say, exit, pursued by a bear.
And then it was, exit, pursued by Yogi Bear.
And then it was just, let's Yogi and Boo-Boo.
It's difficult to put into words.
But if I had to choose three, I would say, really, really sad.
Oh, no, that's two, isn't it?
Uh, you get lost on the ring road again?
What time are you meeting the twins?
Well, we're all at the old familiar.
If you must know-- -It was Sam.
Is there a fucking echo in here?
Wow, you really have a selective memory, don't you?
I told you I had a thing about Sam, and you proceeded to try and get in her pants at every opportunity.
That's right, because you did the school play!
She wore those fishnet stockings, and you got a big boner on stage.
She always had a massive wide-on for Adrian Keane.
-Can we not Talk about my sister In relation to, A-- Massive wide-ons, B-- Steven's erect penis?
-Uh-- -Hey, Steve, she's just got here. Come on.
I'm just gonna nip to the loo.
Gary, you are out of your mind.
Do you really think I'm gonna have sex with you in the ladies' toilet?
Well, the disabled's is out of order.
Maybe one of them put too many paper towels down the toilet.
We don't know what they're thinking, really, do we?
I thought you weren't meeting the twins for another half hour.
Hey, guys, do you know what time it Is?
It is high time we got onto the cock!

Do you remember we used to come in here and listen to him talk about fucking U.F.O.'s And lizard people and underwater Nazis and-- Didn't he spout some bullshit about the Bermuda Triangle actually, being a square?
No, he said it was two isosceles triangles forming a rhombus.
He was your best mate, wasn't he, Steve?
No, he wasn't my best mate, Gary.
He was a lonely old guy, and I felt a bit sorry for him.
Maybe we're not the local legends you think we are.
Have them all in the next one for all I care.
We've gotta have one in every pub, otherwise the whole thing's fucked.
-I'd say it was fairly fucked already, mate.
How much more of this do we have to endure?
We can get some food in the next pub.
As long as it's reasonably healthy.
Hardly the heart of the organic revolution.
I doubt it's the heart of anything.
My wife wanted us to go organic.
The problem is, I kind of like eating shit.
We had a new year's in here, didn't we?
-Isn't that when you slept on the pool table, Andy?
Oh, yeah, when you woke up, we said you'd been asleep for a year and that it was 1991, and you freaked out and punched a clock.
-Didn't you manage to get off with Erika Leekes, Peter?
Something of a personal triumph, if I say so myself.
She of the marmalade sandwich fame.
Two blondes and a redhead in the middle.
I mean, sitting at that table over there are two blondes and a redhead in the middle.
Erika Leekes on the left, Tracy Benson on the right.
And by process of elimination, that's Becky Salt in the middle.
Leave the past where it is.
You make it sound like we're fucking ancient.
-I mean, sure, Steve's let himself go a bit.
Pete's still got the same haircut, and Oliver's still got his Mark of the devil.
It's a small price to pay for not being called fucking O-Man.
It works for sisters of mercy tattoos as well.
I still like the sisters of mercy.
-Oh, good job, or you'd never go swimming.
Hang on. What happened with Shane Hawkins again?
I'd rather not bring it all up again, if that's okay.
Bottling up past trauma can lead to inadequate coping strategies in later life Apparently.
I-It's not about the fact that he bullied me, that he made me miss more school days than chicken pox.
It's not even that he forced me to spend entire lessons hiding in a toilet cubicle, or that he punched me so hard he dislodged my eyeball.
And it's not even that he ruined a large portion of my childhood.
No, it's the fact that just then, he didn't recognize me.
He looked straight through me, like it all meant nothing.
And that probably sounds weird, doesn't it?
Firstly, Peter was talking about something which clearly made him feel very uncomfortable.
Secondly, 12 pints is more than enough.
And thirdly, I don't fucking drink.
I kn-- but shots don't count, do they?
You said you wanted to catch up and chew the fat. I think you just wanted to drink it.
We're not here as your friends.
-Is that a thing now, is it?
You don't need us to help you get fucked up.
You have done a perfectly good job so far on your own.
I'm gonna go and see if there's a bus back to London, if anyone wants to come with me.
But it's the anniversary of the year, isn't it?
-Every year is the anniversary of a year!
-And it's not that the town's changed. We have changed.
Yeah, well, you can't go 'cause the buses are finished.
Then I'm gonna go back to the B and B.
-I could do with an early one, actually.
Yeah, I'm gonna go and find Sam with Oliver.
Yeah, you've got your houses and your cars And your wives and your job security.
You don't have what I have-- freedom.
You're all slaves, and I am free to do what I want any old time.
And this is what you want?
I can't help feeling sorry for him.
Punched the shit out of the wall.
You guys look like you're having a good night though.
I'm doing The Golden Mile tonight, if you wanna tag along.
We could be like the six Musketeers.
I said we're doing The Golden Mile.
You think you're so cool, don't you?
Hey! Look at me when I'm talking to you.
You don't want to do that.
-Andy, this kid just attacked-- -Don't you dare change the subject!
-He smashed my head in the mirror!
Andy-- His head just came off!
No, Gary! You are not gonna wriggle out of it this time!
Ah! Get off-- Get off of me!
Andy, did you see th-- Whoa!
What the fuck does W.T.F. mean?
This can't be happening, can it?
You just said you don't know how far this goes.
I was just thinking about the pub.
This explains why everything's gone fuck-up.
Everybody's been replaced by one of these. That's why no one recognized us!
Look, whatever the fuck's happening, we can't stay in the gents forever.
Ten people have entered this toilet in the last five minutes, and not a single one's come back out again.
And that's worse than five dismembered bodies?
I say we neck these and get the fuck out of here.
Are you saying we move on to the next pub?
We should get in the beast and head back to London.
I don't wanna put any more points on Pete's license.
A-- we're all drunk, B-- they might be in on it, and C-- we've got blood on our hands.
So, has it got messy yet?
Plenty more fun to be had.
The way I see it, -we've told everybody we're doing The Golden Mile.
If we suddenly jump in the beast now and head for the hills, they're gonna know that we know.
But if we keep doing what we're doing And going where we're going, then they're not gonna know.
I suggest we finish what we started and leave quietly in the morning.
You're really suggesting-- We finish The Golden Mile.
five friends on a night out, having a good time.
I feel a little uncomfortable drinking this much.
No, man, it's like Dutch courage, isn't it?
You know, when the English soldiers used to drink Dutch gin before battle To give them super strength.
I thought that was to numb the sense of impending doom.
We're just five friends on a night out, having a good time.
He didn't make it this far last time.
Yeah, five guys on a night out, having a great time.
Pretending to have a great time.
If we get out of here alive, I'm gonna kill you.
We're still in the dark here, Gary.
Our families could be in danger for all we know.
-Hey, why don't we just ask somebody?
Hey! What the fuck are you doing?
I'm gonna go and have a little chat with the Reverend Green.
I'm gonna go over there and subtly check If that is the Reverend Green, and if it is, I can ask him what's going on.
What if he's one of them?
Look, me and the reverend had a highly sophisticated code When discussing the purchase of herbal narcotics.
If he doesn't understand me, it means he's one of them, and I will simply walk away.
'Cause drug dealing's not good enough for you?
There are no drug dealers anymore, Gary.
I've got a proper job and a proper office.
Nothing wrong with doing your business in the toilet.
Look, a lot has changed since you've left.
Do you even know what robot means?
It's like, hello. I am a robot.
It means slave, and believe me, they're not slaves.
The town's been invaded by robots who aren't robots, and the rev's their prisoner.
Yeah, put a cork in it, Trevor.
They will have everything in hand.
Well, the word robot Actually comes from an old Czech word.
Could you put Trevor on, please?
I suggest you get on your way.
I think we should do what he says.
Let's just get in and out of this one, yeah?
-Uh-- -Might I recommend five pints of crowning glory?
Rather fitting, wouldn't you say, Gary?
It's a delightful brew-- hoppy, nutty, foamy.
Does it have a surprisingly fruity note that lingers on the tongue?
Then you'll already know that it's a rare treat For rogues, reverends, royalty and all good folks between.
I don't remember him being that friendly.
We don't know what they remember.
Maybe he's one of the others, like the Reverend.
Wait. Which ones are the thems again?
Is he one of them, or is he one of them?
We need different terms, one for people that aren't robots-- And one for robots who aren't robots.
We need to be able to differentiate between them, them and us.
Yeah, I think the pronouns are really confusing.
I don't even know what a pronoun is.
It's a word that can function by itself, as a noun, which refers to something else.
Look, we just need a fucking word So we can identify who's who.
Those two people are definitely blanks.
What do you mean, sort of?
You come back and everything's the same, but sort of different.
What are you getting at, Gary?
Why are we in the disabled toilets then?
There's something I need to tell you. Unless you want to have sex, in which case I'll tell you afterwards.
Apart from the fact that they're twins?
Just because they're twins doesn't automatically make them creepy.
A-- It's a small town, B-- I'm not stupid, and C-- They told me.
Which was creepy, 'cause it was like there was four of them.
Is this what you wanted to tell me?
I think we should get away from the whole robots thing.
Oh, my God, that man is full of shit.
-I know that's not a surprise to you.
He said that Newton Haven Has been taken over by robots full of blue stuff, and if we don't do what they say, they'll make us their prisoners.
You know better than to believe Gary King.
Otherwise people are going to ask what the hell is going on.
We have been through some crazy shit tonight.
And if everything is as fucked up as it seems, then there's something I need to tell you.
You might think this is because I've had seven pints, but it's not.
And it breaks my heart to see you waste your affections on Gary fucking King.
-There is nothing between me-- -And while I'm being honest, just to lay it all out there, I am currently seeing a fitness instructor.
She's 26 years old, but I would drop her in a heartbeat If it meant that I had one last chance with you.
Steven, there is nothing between me and Gary King.
Hey! Get your feet off her!
N-nothing suggested in the last three minutes Has been better than smashy-smashy egg men.
Did you guys think of a name for the robots who aren't robots?
I'm afraid we've drawn a blank.
Well, we just had a Barney with two blanks in the beer garden.
Gary thinks we should keep up with the crawl, because they know what we're doing, but they don't know that we know what they're doing.
And basically, n-no one else has a better idea, so fuck it.
a better idea. I'm parked right around here somewhere.
This is a bit mad, isn't it?
Hey, keep an eye out for blanks.
About what you said in the garden.
I just-- never seemed like the right moment.
Something always got in the way.
I knew seeing your faces again would spell trouble!
Wait. How do I know it's really you?
Because I'm the only one who's going to tell you the truth about Newton Haven.
Now, do you recall the events of the evening Of June the 22nd, 1990?
That was the night they arrived.
They were getting ready, burrowing in underground.
Not long after you lot left, people started to change.
Just one or two at first.
They replaced people of influence, taking over the institutions.
Doing everything they could to make us join them!
It's not like the replacements were evil.
They don't want to get rid of us, not if they can help it.
They just want to make us more like them-- Change the way we think, bring us into line with all the others, become another link in their chain.
Which is fine, unless you say no.
Once they get your D.N.A., they've got you.
Blood tests, the nit nurse, sweat, kissing, saliva on the rim of a glass.
Why do you think I drink with this crazy straw?
Not so crazy now, is it?
If you're not on their side, they'll create a version that is.
They can bring you back exactly the same or even make you young again.
But really, it's just a vessel to spread their message.
Trust, love, respect, desire-- Replaced in the name of progress.
So what happens to the people that get replaced?
Don't ask me what happens to them.
Go. Get out, before it's too late.
Sam, who was the boy that you liked in sixth form?
We have to get out of here!
Adrian Keane was in that bar.
I thought you liked Adrian Keane.
Adrian Keane died in a motorbike accident in Italy eight years ago.
That's how they were able to replicate him.
They know how to get to us, man.
They didn't know Adrian was dead.
They knew these three would fall for a bunch of girls in school uniform.
We gotta get out of town.
Another good name for the band, Steve.
Y-you're putting our lives in the hands of a crazy old man.
Or maybe he's a blank trying to lure us to the edge of town Onto those dark country roads where they can deal with us.
Yeah, we could end up dead in a field.
Look, we are going to the beehive! Gary's plan is still the best we have.
1990-model Oliver was out of commission by this point in the evening.
Oh, this is a mistake, isn't it?
Now, then, whose round is it?
Why don't you kids join me?
You look like you could do with a drink.
Now, let's have a little chat About your future, shall we, hmm?
Does anyone know what robot means?
No, Peter, of course I'm not a robot.
But you're on their side though.
This is not about sides, Steven.
It's not about shirts versus skins.
It's about working together as one team.
I know it may seem a bit weird and a little bit scary, but please believe me, it's quite the opposite.
They're here to help, to straighten us out, to prepare us for the big league.
They've seen something in us-- a potential.
There's a vast community of worlds up there, living together peacefully, cooperatively.
So, uh, they're not here to harm us?
Oh, far from it, O-Man, no.
I'm not saying they're afraid to get tough.
I've certainly had to get tough with you in my day.
And what one amongst you wouldn't thank me for it, hmm?
In some respect, they're a lot like teachers.
But it's all for our betterment.
So, what do you say We all go somewhere and talk about this properly?
What Mr. Shepherd is trying to say is that-- Whoa!
If you will not join us willingly, we will be forced to use other means of persuasion.
Now, please-- I fucking hate this town!
This is no way for a family to behave.
It doesn't have to be like this.
It could be so much simpler, so completely painless.
If only you'd see the light.
You see, it's not about conflict.
Let's try this again, shall we?
That appears to be the case.
Humans, this is your final warning.
Humans, obey now, or face the consequences.
I don't know if that's true, Gary.
Will you find out what happened to my brother?
And I-I'll look after Stevie for you, eh?
Gary, you're not a bad person.
You know, the whole free spirit, quick one in the disabled toilets thing, I-it's kind of cool when you're 17, but not when you're facing 40.
There comes a time you have to go forwards, not backwards.
maybe if I hadn't left you behind that night, things would all be different.
It's not all about that night, Gary.
We'll always have the disabled's though, won't we?
Yeah, we'll always have the disabled's.
You just sent away the-the only one of us sober enough to drive?
You just couldn't stand the fact that she might prefer me to you.
Jesus! I do something right for a change, and you fuckers get on my case.
Wow, that is the first time I've ever heard you admit being wrong.
-Look, I just thought it was best To keep her out of harm's way.
How do we know you put her in the car?
How do we know you're you?
But who the fuck are you, Gary?
-How do I know you guys are you?
Well, you might all not be you.
-How did you know O-Man wasn't O-Man?
That's why he had his birthmark.
Oliver with none of the shit that had happened to the real Oliver.
So the blanks really are just blank?
Steven, 1987-- We were playing cricket, and I accidentally pushed you onto a broken bottle that nearly went up your ass.
Pete, you got that 50 c.c. Suzuki in 1988.
